com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.policy.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Traceable, Evaluatable, Matchable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DOMRule

    public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
implements Matchable, Evaluatable, Traceable
    Rule extends PolicyComponent to represent a XACML Rule within a Policy. It implements Matchable and Evaluatable for matching and evaluation a request.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    car

        public MatchResult match(EvaluationContext evaluationContext)
                  throws EvaluationException
        Description copied from interface: Matchable
        Matches this Matchable in the given EvaluationContext and returns a MatchResult.
        Specified by:
        match in interface Matchable
        Parameters:
        evaluationContext - the EvaluationContext to use in matching
        Returns:
        a MatchResult indicating whether this Matchable matches against the given EvaluationContext.
        Throws:
        EvaluationException - if there is an error testing the match.

        public java.lang.String getTraceId()

        Gets the String identifier for the object that caused the TraceEvent as a result of a policy evaluation method. Implementations must not return null.
        Specified by:

      • getCause

        public Traceable getCause()
        Description copied from interface: Traceable
        Gets the Traceable that caused the evaluation method on this Traceable to be called. If there is no known causing object, this method should return null.
        Specified by:
        getCause in interface Traceable
        Returns:

        public java.lang.String getStatusMessage()

        Returns:
        the String status message associated with this PolicyComponent or null if none

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(StatusCode statusCodeIn,
             java.lang.String messageIn)
        Sets the StatusCode and String status message for this PolicyComponent. This method is mainly provided for objects that may have lazy evaluations performed on them, in which case the status is not determined until the object is actually used.
        Parameters:
        statusCodeIn - the StatusCode for this PolicyComponent
        messageIn - the String status message for this PolicyComponent

      • isOk

        public boolean isOk()
        Does a check on the StatusCode for this element to determine if it is equivalent to the OK status code.
        Returns:
        true if the StatusCode is equivalent to OK, otherwise false

      • validate

        public boolean validate()
        If a StatusCode has not been set, ask this PolicyComponent to validate itself and return the value from the validation. Otherwise, check to see if the cached StatusCode indicates this PolicyComponent is valid.
        Returns:
        true if this PolicyComponent is valid, else false.
